data.title: Nice place
data.text: This place has a beautiful ambiance.... I have been a few times good service and the food is in the medium range of what I like....I wish it stood up to the decor though.  I also had to teach my bartender to make a fairly simple cocktail....so as a place to go for a drink...keep it simple.

data.title: Very good
data.text: My experience is that this was everything you want a restaurant to be plus a super unique atmosphere. The food was very tasty and prices were reasonable. Definitely a place to try out!!

data.title: Cozy, like a saloon inside
data.text:
I was reminded of walking into a saloon, this one being length-wise. No dancers, no costumes, not incredibly noisy, just "the look." It's a little dark in there, though not gloomy or otherwise uncomfortable. Service was okay, though not comparable to what you might experience due to my being part of a larger group.
On another's recommendation, I had the fish and chips, which is something the menu trumpets. Most of our group opted for the two-piece version, with maybe one braving the three-piece version. For a modest lunch, two pieces was sufficient, and the taste was very good, certainly at least a couple of cuts above frozen, almost enough to yearn for ordering the three-piece. If I went there again, I would order the three-piece, hoping to take the third home, but probably eating it all. The speed in getting in and out was excellent, though the place wasn't bustling, it was perhaps half full.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Nice atmosphere, historical setting, quiet.  The waitress was attentive & came back several times to check on food and water refills.

data.title: Cute place for lunch
data.text: Nice nostalgic place for a bite or beverage. Good service, quaint old fashioned theme, good food. Very enjoyable experience.

data.title: Do Not Try
data.text: The food is poor, hardly any beverage selection, Horrible Service., seriously, the waitress spilled on me, then offered a companion 'free tea'...(this is with more than one try, at least 3) Not very clean, waitstaff has no response to requests.

data.title: Great ambiance in this Historic Place
data.text: A quick late lunch was enjoyable, but not exceptional. Lots of food for the $$$. We had soup, salad & bread.

data.title: Friendly and local
data.text: The menu is not very challenging, and the decor isn't particularly original, but the food is good, the place is clean, and the staff is attentive and welcoming - which is quite a challenge given that the diners might include a party of grandparents in Birkenstocks at one table, and a couple of young parents with the dad outfitted with a shaved punk mohawk at another. The downtown is clearly going through some hard economic times, but like the Vintage Cafe, it's clean, well managed and surprisingly good.

data.title: Not good
data.text: My wife and I ate here and were very impressed by the service and drinks that we ordered.  However it all went quickly downhill when we got our food.  Despite their claims of handmade food, everything on our plates came either out of a can or a box.  It was pretty disappointing to spend nearly $80 on a dinner I could have bought in the frozen section at my local grocery store, took back to the hotel and nuked it for a lot less money.....I guess I've never seen perfectly square shaped calamari before?  Made from scratch, what a laugh!

data.title: Homemade food and excellent atmosphere!!
data.text: This was on our "to try" list and we were not disappointed!!! Inside a 1892 building which in itself is amazing. Found out all the food is hand made!! Has 3 of the specials-vintage dip, roast beef and cheddar, and the turkey bacon ranch wrap. All were amazing!!! Wonderful flavors in each. And the sides!! The clam chowder and mulligan soup wonderful!!!!! We will definitely be back and recommend to visiting friends!!!!

data.title: A Fun Place To Just Hang Out
data.text: I was there for a late lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it.  This was a relaxing place, perfect to just hang out. The service was really good and the food was well prepared and presented, with adequate portion size.  There were four in our party and each had praise for the meal they ordered.  I ordered the fish and chips and I was not disappointed.

data.title: Charm in Downtown Everett.
data.text: We enjoyed breakfast at the Vintage Cafe.  Food is great, people are great and the location and ambiance were fantastic.  I recommend an Irish Coffee as well!  Highly recommend the Pancakes.  My wife saw a three stack go to another table and could not believe the size and fluffiness of the pancakes!  So we had to try one!  We were not disappointed...they were as tasty as they were aesthetically appealing on the plate!  Yummy.

data.title: Decent lunch
data.text: My daughter and I had lunch here before going to Xfinity Arena. Many different types of sandwiches and salads are offered. Our food was good, but our server had too many tables for one person.

data.title: Good food
data.text: I took my daughter to lunch this afternoon. It took awhile to get our order submitted but the food was really good. Cute place, we would come back.

data.title: Good food when you get it
data.text: Good food, good location, cozy dinning area.  The staff seems unhappy and are usually in disagreement with who should be pouring coffee, making cocktails and which table they are serving etc..

data.title: WE do breakfasts.
data.text: their breakfast here are very good also .. we enjoy these Sunday morning feast plenty of food. the big Man breakfast is great.

data.title: Checking out a local place
data.text: The poutine was good simple gravy and cheese.  The waitstaff was friendly and charming.  We asked if the place was haunted due to the age of the building, the staff said no but could have fooled us.

data.title: This local cafe is a treasure!
data.text: This restaurant in downtown Everett won't disappoint. It has flavorful, tasty food--whether you are here for breakfast, lunch or dinner, fabulous prices, and delightful old-town atmosphere in a century-and-a-half-old building,. You really can't go wrong; we've been here a few times and have enjoyed it very much each time. And if you're in town for an event, it's close to the theatre and the ice-hockey rink.

data.title: We are regulars and like the breakfast for our family group of 8
data.text: So we like the breakfasts they serve, and have found the service mostly good. Very consistently good, solid breakfast. The coffee is my only complaint. Yuck! The place is clean, but in an old building, which gives character and ambiance but  not hospital sanitation. I am picky about cleanliness and the Vintage appears OK in the dining and bathrooms.  In all the times we've been there over the last 10 years,  we've only had 1 bad service incident, which was resolved. If you want a family friendly place and a local, non-chain experience with Everett ambiance and local (verses tourist) prices you will like this place just fine.  It is seat yourself, so just go in and find a likely spot.  Oh-on chilly days the tables near the doors get cold drafts, so sit near the bar instead!

data.title: Great Ambiance, Average Food
data.text: We went ttis restaurant for lunch with a party of 8.  The service was great, the food was average.  My clam strips appeared to be purchased from the frozen food section at Costco.  One of our party ordered a hamburger, and it was over cooked and dry.  All and all, I would probably not go back a second time.
